info.description:
The Network API allows to provide a clear visibility on the deployed Network solutions and Equipements. This API provides the full inventory, QoS and usage reports.  
Most of Network Offers are supported.
  

### Internationalization
By default, data are in English but you can request data in French by specifying a language code in the Accept-Language header.
_Example: Accept-Language: fr_

### Resources 
- **accessLines** : An Access Line (or Circuit) is the physical line supporting the service such as Optical Fiber or DSL.
- **devices** : A device is an equipement of the WAN or LAN network for example a Router. Devices can be also virtual.
- **interfaces** : An Interface is a physical port of a device.
- **locations** : A location is a Geographical place like a building.
- **pointOfPresences** : Point of Presence is a Orangecenter containing Network Equipments.
- **servicePoints** : Service Point is an installed Offer such as a BVPN site. You will find Commercial information on this object.


### Scopes

| Scope | Features |
| --- | --- |
| b2b:network| Full access of the API. |
| b2b:network:readonly | API limited to read actions |  


# Authentication

The authentication is based on OAuth 2.0 and and API Key provided by Orange Business Services
info.title: Network

tags.name: Access Lines
tags.description: An Access Lines is a connectivity link between a WAN device and a Point of Presence (MPLS, Internet..)

tags.name: Devices
tags.description: Physical or virtual Network equipments such Routers, Switches, vEdge, Cloud vEdge or uCPE

tags.name: Device Interfaces
tags.description: ##overview The interfaces on a router provide network connectivity to the router. Physical & Virtual interfaces of a vEdge

tags.name: Locations
tags.description: A Location is a geographical place where the service, equipments is installed. The method lists mainly Customer premises.

tags.name: Service Points
tags.description: The service Point corresponds to an Installed Service. The item will provide commercial informations.

tags.name: Points Of Presence
tags.description: Operator nodes for connecting Customer Equipments

tags.name: Miscellaneous
tags.description: Methods for having information on the API such as the version, status or for downloading the Swagger.

get.description: This method allows to list all Access Lines or Circuits matching criterias.

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first element to retrieve. Zero is the first item of the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of Access Lines to return.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The field name to sort the result. Prefixing a field name with a "-" sign indicates a descending order. __Example: sort=-name

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Allow to reduce the response by specifying only necessary fields. Attributes are separated by a comma.

parameters.name: displayLinks
parameters.description: Flag for displaying the HATEOS links of linked ressources.

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: Flag for displaying all fields even if the value is null.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Single Identifier.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Device Name.

parameters.name: customer.id
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula faboutthe Customer Single Identifier.

parameters.name: customer.name
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Customer Name.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact vavalue or formula about the Access Line Type.

parameters.name: properties.role
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Topology Role.

parameters.name: carrier.id
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Single Identifier of the Access Line Carrier.

parameters.name: carrier.name
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Name of the Access Line Carrier.

parameters.name: device.id
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Single Identifier of the Device where the Access Line is connected.

parameters.name: device.name
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Name of the Device where the Access Line is connected.

parameters.name: device.customerReference
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Customer Reference of the Device where the Access Line is connected.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Provisioning state (limited number of values).

parameters.name: servicePoints.id
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Single identifier of the Service Point linked to the Access Line.

parameters.name: servicePoints.name
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Name of the Service Point linked to the Access Line.

parameters.name: servicePoints.customerReference
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Customer Reference of the Service Point linked to the Access Line.

parameters.name: keyDates.activatedAt
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the date whe then Access Line has been activated by the Carrier.

parameters.name: keyDates.startedAt
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the date when the Access Line was Ready for Service.

parameters.name: keyDates.billingStartedAt
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the date when the billing of the Access Line started.

parameters.name: keyDates.billingEndedAt
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the date when the billing of the Access Line stopped after a disconnection.

parameters.name: keyDates.terminatedAt
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the date when the Access Line was disconnected.

parameters.name: keyDates.orderedAt
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the date when the Access Line has been ordered.

parameters.name: location.id
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Single Identifier of the Location where the Access Line was deployed.

parameters.name: location.name
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Name of the Location where the Access Line was deployed.
Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Customer Reference of the Location where the Access Line was deployed.
parameters.name: location.customerReference
location.address.city
parameters.description: Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the City of the Location where the Access Line was deployed.

Returns Access Lines that match the exact value or formula about the Country Code of the Location where the Access Line was deployed. The code follow the [ISO-3166-1 alpha 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) specifications.

get.description:
This method allows to count Access Lines items futher one or several attributes and matching criterias.

This feature is useful for building dashboards.

For example, the call `GET /accessLines/aggregate?groupBy=state`

will returns

`
{
   'INSTALLING': 5,
   'OPERATIONAL' : 10,
   'TERMINATED' : 2
}
`

The _groupBy_ Query Parameter supports several attributes ex:  ` GET /requests/aggregate?groupBy=status,offer.family`

get.description:
This end-point returns a list of devices by default sorted by the id.
The number of returned items is by default 25 but it can be changed with query parameters.

----------

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first element to retrieve. Zero is the first item of the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The field name to sort the result. Prefixing a field name with a "-" sign will indicate a descending \sorder.
__Example: sort=-name

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The list of field names to retrieve. You can specify a field, a resource or a resourceâ€™s field.\s
__Example: fields=name,status

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: Flag for displaying all fields even if the value is null.

parameters.description: Returns Devices that are virtual (_isVirtual=true_) or physical (_isVirtual=false_).

parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Provisioning State of the Device.

parameters.name: location.address.country

parameters.name: offer.id
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Orange Single Identifier of the Offer associated to the Device.

parameters.name: offer.name
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Orange Name of the Offer associated to the Device.

parameters.name: community
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Network community of the Device.

parameters.name: hardware.model
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Model of the Device.

parameters.name: hardware.family
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Product Family of the Device.

parameters.name: hardware.chassis
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Chassis reference of the Device as indicated thru Device Console.

parameters.name: hardware.manufacturer
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Manufacturer Name of the Device.

parameters.name: hardware.serialNumber
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Serial Number of the Device.

parameters.name: servicePoint.id
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Single Identifier of Service Point associated to the Device.

parameters.name: servicePoint.name
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Name of Service Point associated to the Device.

parameters.name: servicePoint.customerReference
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Customer Reference of Service Point associated to the Device.

parameters.name: topology.role
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Topology role of the Device (Limited Number of Values).

parameters.name: topology.isCascaded
parameters.description: Returns Devices that are Cascaded (_isCascaded=true_) or not Cascaded (_iscascaded=)false_).

parameters.name: topology.mplsUnderlaySiteName
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the MPLS Site Name of the Device.

parameters.name: topology.mplsUnderlaySiteType
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the MPLS Site Type of the Device.

parameters.name: topology.layer
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Topology Layer of the Device (Limited Number of Values).

parameters.name: settings.function
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the Function of the Device.

parameters.name: keyDates.startedAt
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the date when the Access Line was Ready for Service.

parameters.name: keyDates.discoveredAt
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the last discovered date of the Device by Orange Probes.

parameters.name: createdAt
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the creation date of Access Line in API ecosystem. This filter allows more efficient synchronization mechanism.

parameters.name: updatedAt
parameters.description: Returns Devices that match the exact value or formula about the last update date of Access Line in API ecosystem. This filter allows more efficient synchronization mechanism.

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: Includes additional items in the response (Limited number of values). Several values can be specified with a comma for sepating values.

get.description:
This method allows to count Access Lines items futher one or several attributes and matching criterias.

This feature is useful for building dashboards.

For example, the call `GET /accessLines/aggregate?groupBy=state`

will returns

`
{
   'INSTALLING': 5,
   'OPERATIONAL' : 10,
   'TERMINATED' : 2
}
`

The _groupBy_ Query Parameter supports several attributes ex:  ` GET /requests/aggregate?groupBy=status,offer.family`

Returns all available information about the device.

----------

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Orange Single Identifier of the device

parameters.name: displayLinks
parameters.description: Flag for displaying the HATEOS links of linked ressources.

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: Flag for displaying all fields even if the value is null.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
Allow to reduce the response by specifying only necessary fields. Attributes are separated by a comma.
__Example: fields=name,status_

parameters.name: includes
parameters.description: Indicates a list of sub resource to include in the response. Names are separated by a comma

get.description:
This end-point returns a list of interfaces of a device sorted by the name.
The number of returned items is by default 20 but it can be changed with query parameters.

----------

parameters.name: deviceId
parameters.description: Orange Single Identifier of a network device.

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The index of the first element to retrieve. Zero is the first item of the collection.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The maximum number of items to retrieve.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: The comma-separated list of field names to sort the result. Prefixing a field name with a "-" sign will indicate a descending order.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description:
The list of field names to retrieve.  You can specify a field, a resource or a resource's field.
_Example: &fields=reference,status,type,primaryContact.name_

parameters.name: displayLinks
parameters.description: Flag for displaying the HATEOS links of linked ressources.

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: Flag for displaying all fields even if the value is null.

get.description:
This method allows to count Service Points items futher one or several attributes and matching criterias.

This feature is useful for building dashboards.

For example, the call `GET /servicePoints/aggregate?groupBy=state`

will returns

`
{
   'INSTALLING': 5,
   'OPERATIONAL' : 10,
   'TERMINATED' : 2
}
`

The _groupBy_ Query Parameter supports several attributes ex:  ` GET /servicePoints/aggregate?groupBy=status,offer.family`

get.summary: Return all information of a Point Of Service
get.description: Return all information of a Point Of Service

parameters.name: pointOfPresenceId
parameters.description: Orange Single Identifier of a Point of Service

parameters.name: X-API-KEY
parameters.description: The API Key required for using Orange Business Services API.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Allow to reduce the response by specifying only necessary fields. Attributes are separated by a comma.

parameters.name: displayLinks
parameters.description: Flag for displaying the HATEOS links of linked ressources.

parameters.name: displayNulls
parameters.description: Flag for displaying all fields even if the value is null.

get.description: This method returns the status of the API.
This method returns the detailed version of the API
This method provides the swagger for Network for Business API

schema.description: Size of the Swagger File in octets.

Content-Length.description: Size of the Swagger File in octets.

LocationType.description: List of type of location for example if it is a shop or a factory.

DeviceTopologyRole.description: Role of the device in the topology. For example, if the mode is DUAL_BACK, the router can be main device some PRIMARY. If the device is a backup of the main device, the value will be SECONDARY. Values depend of the offer, please consult the documentation of the service.

DeviceFields.description: List of fields for a partial reponse.

DeviceSort.description: List of fields for sorting a reponse.

LocationSort.description: List of fields for sorting the reponse.

AccessLineRole.description: List of Roles available for an Access Line..

AccessLineType.description: List of possible values of Access Line Type.

AccessLineFields.description: List of fields for a partial reponse.

AccessLineSort.description: List of fields for sorting the reponse.

ServicePointFields.description: List of fields for a partial reponse.

ServicePointSort.description: List of fields for sorting a reponse.

PointOfPresenceFields.description: List of fields for a partial reponse.

PointOfPresenceSort.description: List of fields for sorting a reponse.

AccessLineState.description: Provisionning State of the Access Line

DeviceIncludes.description: List of Nested resource to add in the response.

DeviceTopologyLayer.description: Layer where the device is operating.

DeviceTopologyMode.description: Mode of the topology. The mode depends of the offer associated to the device.

ServicePointIncludes.description: List of Nested resources to include in the response.

DeviceType.description: Type of the device for example for WAN service routers are deployed and the value for such device will be ROUTER.

ServicePointState.description: Provisioning State of the Service Point.

DeviceState.description: Provisioning state of the device. **INSTALLING** when Orange is deploying the device, **OPERATIONAL** when the router is deployed and **TERMINATED** when the device is decommisionned.

ActionInProgress.description: Information the current action planned or in progress.

infoURL.description: URL for additional information on the error.

extendedStreet.description: Additional street information of the site

state.description: State where the site is located. Only for US

country.description: The country code of the location. The code follow the [ISO-3166-1 alpha 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) specifications.

id.description: Orange Single identifier of the Customer (~customer code).
Orange Single identifier of the device.

name.description: Orange Name of the device defined by Orange Business Services. Example BVPN SMOW2542.

customerReference.description: Reference (or name) of the device assigned by the Customer. Example BVPN: CRUMOS002CA901.

isVirtual.description: Flag indicating if the device is virtual. when the value is true, the device is virtual (vEdge cloud for example), if the value is false, it is a physical device.

installedAt.description:
Date when the device has been installed.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09_

startedAt.description:
Date when the device has been declared ready for service.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09_.

billingStartedAt.description:
Date when the billing of this device started after a disconnection for example.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09_.

billingEndedAt.description:
Date when the billing was stopped after a disconnection request for example. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09_.

discoveredAt.description:
Date when the device was reached by Orange probes.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_.

terminatedAt.description:
Date when the device has been removed from the service. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09_.

createdAt.description:
Date when the device record was created in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. There is no business meaning, helps only for synchronisation of data.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_.

DeviceInterface.description: Model description of a Device Interface

id.description: Single identifier of the interface composed of the device name and the interface?

name.description: User friendly name of the interface

usage.description: Type of usage of the Interface. For example WAN or LAN, etc..

description.description: Description available in the configuration for this Interface

isActive.description: Flag indicating if the Interface is active in the configuration of the device

isLogical.description: Flags indicating if the interface is logical

port.description: Number of the port of the interface

slot.description: Number of the slot of the interface

vrf.description: Name of the VRF configured for the interface

vlan.description: VALN id defined on the Interface

isCascaded.description: Flag indicating if the device is behind another WAN device (cascaded). If the value is true, the device is cascaded.

DeviceLinks.description: Model listing all links available on a Device Model

id.description: Single Identifier of the location

localCompany.description: Name of the company in the premises

customerReference.description: External Reference of the location. This reference is set by Customer.

formattedAddress.description: Complete formatted address of the location

id.description: Single Identifier of the Device.

DeviceInterfaceShort.description: Information on the physical interface for logical interface.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Interface.
Orange Single Identifier of an Offer

name.description: Name of the main Offer associatzed to the device

deprecated.description: Flag indicating that API is deprecated

Status.description: Information on the status of the API.

version.description: API version (major dot minor dot patch numbers).

memorySize.description: Size of the installed memory in the device. Value in kOctets

cpuType.description: CPU type of the device provided by the Manufacturer.

cpuReference.description: CPU reference of the device provided by the Manufacturer.

cpuCount.description: Indicate the number of cpu installed in the Device

cpuSpeed.description: Indicate the speed of the Processor of the Device in Ghz

diskSize.description: Indicate the size of the disk in kOctets

networkPortCount.description: Number of port on the device.

hostname.description: hostname defined in the device configuration

countControlConnections.description: Number of connections for a SDWAN device

payload.description: Body for POST or PATCH methods

title.description: Title of the Primary Contact. For example: _M._

name.description: Full Name of the Primary Contact.

firstName.description: First Name of the Primary Contact.

lastName.description: Last Name of the Primary Contact.

phone.description: Phone Number of the Primary Contact.

mobile.description: Mobile Number of the Primary Contact.

title.description: Title of the Secondary Contact. For example: _M._

name.description: Full Name of the Secondary Contact.

firstName.description: First Name of the Secondary Contact.

lastName.description: Last Name of the Secondary Contact.

phone.description: Phone Number of the Secondary Contact.

mobile.description: Mobile Number of the Secondary Contact.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Entity.

Manager.description: Entity in change of the Management of the device.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Entity.

Support.description: Entity in charge of the Support of the device.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Entity.

maskV4.description: IP mask of the subnet in v6 format

maskLengthV4.description: IP Variable Length Subnet Mask in v4 format

maskV6.description: IP mask of the subnet in v6 format

id.description: Single Identifier of the location

customerReference.description: External Reference of the location. This reference is set by Customer.

formattedAddress.description: Complete address including street, city and Country.

createdAt.description:
Date when the device record was created in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. There is no business meaning, helps only for synchronisation of data.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

HyperlinkLocation.description: HATEOS links on the nested resources.

AccessLine.description: Information on an Access Line (or Circuit)

id.description: Orange Single identifier of the Access Line.

customerReference.description: Reference set by the Customer on the Access Line.

carrierReference.description: Reference of the Access Line provided by the Carrier.

carrierSecondaryReference.description: Alternate reference of the Access Line provided by  the Carrier.

activatedAt.description: Date when the Access Line has been activated. The format of the date use the [ISO-8601 format](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).

startedAt.description: Date when the service on the Access Line started. The format of the date use the [ISO-8601 format](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).

billingStartedAt.description: Date when the billing of the Access Line started. The format of the date use the [ISO-8601 format](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).

billingStoppedAt.description: Date when the billing of the Access Line was stopped after a disconnection request. The format of the date use the [ISO-8601 format](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).

terminatedAt.description: Date when the Access Line has been disconnected from the network. The format of the date use the [ISO-8601 format](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).

orderedAt.description: Date when the Access Line was ordered. The format of the date use the [ISO-8601 format](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime).

createdAt.description:
Date when the device record was created in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. There is no business meaning, helps only for synchronisation of data.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

Carrier.description: Information on the Carrier providing the Access Line

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of a Carrier

AccessLineDevice.description: Information on the device using this Access Line.

id.description: Orange Single Indentifier of the device

customerReference.description: Reference of the device set by the Customer

DeviceInterfaceLight.description: Information on the device attached to the Access Line.

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the device interface where the access line is connected.

isInternet.description: Flag indicating if the line is an Internet Access Line. true= Internet, false= not Internet.

isQuickStart.description: Flag indicating that the line is a temporary Line deployed for starting the service (often a mobile 4G access line).

bandwidth.description: Access bandwidth  for the Access Line  (value in kB).

rx.description: Reception bandwidth. The unit is specified in the _unit_ attribute.

tx.description: Transmit bandwidth. The unit is specified in the _unit_ attribute.

unit.description: Unit of the bandwidth such as kB/s.

phoneNumber.description: Phonenumber of the Access Line in case of DSL for example. The value can be null if not relevant for the support.

reference.description: Internal Reference for identying the Access Line.

vci.description: Contains the Virtual Circuit Identifier. Used for DSL Access Line.

vpi.description: Contains the Virtual Path Identifier. Used only for DSL Line.

id.description: Single Identifier of a Service Point.

customerReference.description: Reference of the Service Point set by the Customer.

category.description: Category of a Service Point. This value is defined by the Customer during the Ordering process.

criticality.description: criticality of a Service Point. This value is defined by the Customer during the Ordering process.

orderedAt.description: Date when the service/device has been ordered.

createdAt.description:
Date when the device record was created in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. There is no business meaning, helps only for synchronisation of data.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of the Service Point.

name.description: Name of the Service Point composed of the Location name and the installed offer.

customerReference.description: Reference set by the Customer for the Service Point.

DeviceServicePoint.description: Information on the Service Point associated to the device;

PointOfPresences.description: Information on the Point of Presence.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Point of Presence.

name.description: Name of the Point of Presence.

createdAt.description:
Date when the device record was created in the API. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. There is no business meaning, helps only for synchronisation of data.  The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

updatedAt.description:
Date when the record was updated. There is no Business meaning. This field facilitates the data synchronisation. The format is [ISO-8601](https://www.w3.org/TR/NOTE-datetime) format.
_Example: 2015-04-09T12:07:56Z_

PointOfPresenceLocation.description: Information on the location of the Point of Presence.

city.description: City Name where the Point of Presence is located.

country.description: Country Code where the Point Of Presence is located. The code follow the [ISO-3166-1 alpha 2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1) specifications.

DeviceInHouse.description: Additional information where the device is installed.

restoreTime.description: Response Time to restore the service.

responseTime.description: Response Time to fix an issue.

id.description: Orange Single Identifier of a Service Point.

customerReference.description: Customer Reference of the Service Point.

AccessLineServicePoint.description: Service Point of the Access Line.

data.description: Percentage of bandwidth reserved for data trafic.

d1.description: Percentage of bandwidth reserved for data trafic of classe 1.

d2.description: Percentage of bandwidth reserved for data trafic of classe 2.

d3.description: Percentage of bandwidth reserved for data trafic of classe 3.

internet.description: Percentage of bandwidth reserved for internet trafic.

video.description: Percentage of bandwidth reserved for Video trafic.

voice.description: Percentage of bandwidth reserved for Voice trafic.

id.description: Single Identifier of the location

customerReference.description: External Reference of the location. This reference is set by Customer.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Agreement.
Single Identifier of the Billing Account.

isSccActivated.description: Flag indicating if there is a subscription to _'Service Client Conseil'_. This service is available on the France Market.

id.description: Single Identifier of the Network Community.

voip.description: Information onthe Voice Over IP Service.

video.description: Information on the Video Over IP Service.

scopes.b2b:network: Allow to access and manage resources
scopes.b2b:network:readOnly: Allow to access all resources in read mode
